ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Most of these questions could not be answered because they did not apply.
The colloquium was a welcome chance to present the research we had all been working on for two years.
An opportunity to organize research and present findings to FES.
That it forces organization and presentation skills in addition to research skills.
Great scientific and professional preparation to face the world of publication and scientific communication.
Learning what's involved in organizing an academic conference.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I would offer two suggestions for improvement:1. First, the feedback I received on my poster presentation was unacceptably weak. I really received nothing out of the evaluation process, particularly since one of the three evaluations was very negative in some areas. With negative scores, I would have expected at least some critical feedback.2. Second, the fact that there were not enough oral presentation sessions to go around was not really fair. Some of the oral presenters clearly hadn't done much analysis at all on their research, and I felt slighted that I had been relegated to the poster session.

Not all responsibilities were shared by all participating students. Only the students who showed up to the initial meeting were put on a committee. Thus only 25% of students were on a committee and did the work for it. And out of the 25% of students on committees, only 1% did a majority of the work, so overall, only a few students organized the whole thing. This is unbalanced and unfair and those who did not help in organizing should not get credit for it.
It would be nice if there were an opportunity to include the MEMs...but that would also be a good deal more work. Hmm.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This was a great professional building event.
I had to do it as an MESc! But it was good presenting and organizing practice.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: N/A

I personally think good science is about great communication skills. This course provides a useful platform for effective scientific and communications training. My future career includes considerable communication and scientific work.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, except for being one of the only students who really did a majority of the work.
Yes it did!

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: See #13.
Yes.
I did not expect to be the Colloquium to be as demanding and rewarding as it was. I'm glad I was able to partake.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A
essential!

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: N/A
Start early!

Please take it! As a matter of fact, you may have to do it should you be registered for the MFS or MESc. Please ask other colleagues before you get to the semester for the presentations. You may benefit considerably from their experience.
